title: Study, Study
detail_text: <:th_ch0205/>Then, Let’s start today’s Ai-san’s Japanese Study Group!<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0208/>Let’s goooooo-!<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0205/>Yes, Emacchi, great response! That’s right, you use “Let’s gooo!” in these situations!<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0208/>Teacher, what’s the new word of the day?<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0205/>Ahem, today, let’s learn about the word “ぴえん” (Pien)<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0208/>Pien….? I know that word! I used to use it everyday when I was in Switzerland!<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0205/>Eeeh-!? Is that so? Then, “ぴえん” is a Swiss word?<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0208/>“Sono Pieno!” or so we say, it’s Italian. Fufu, to have it be a word used by the Japanese people, what a weird feeling this is. It makes me happy<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0205/>What does that “Pien” mean there?<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0208/>It means “I’m full!” !<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0000/>Translated by SIFAStheatre and Idol Story<:dt_line_end/>
